author: Staff Reporter
text:
A day after the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) sought “cooperation of all democratic forces in the State” to oust the Trinamool Congress (TMC) the ruling party in Bengal tried to put up a brave face.

Speaking to journalists TMC general secretary Subrata Bakshi said that his party is “least bothered” about the Left-Congress alliance.

“We are only bothered about the development work done by the Mamata Banerjee government. Those who are trying to forge an alliance against us have been rejected by the people,” said Mr. Bakshi.

Earlier TMC chairperson Mamata Banerjee said that even if the Left-Congress tie-up takes place it will be “fruitless.”

The pro-alliance leaders in Congress, who are in majority in the State unit, welcomes the CPI(M)’s central leadership’s decision said that every “secular-democratic” force should respect the people’s aspiration.

State Congress president Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that “the work for the alliance has started in Murshidabad district and it will oust the TMC from Bengal.” So far it was only by hand [symbol of Congress] that we had resisted the onslaughts of TMC now the hand has hammer [symbol of CPI(M) – star, sickle, hammer], the State Congress president said.

Senior Congress leaders from Bengal including MP Pradip Bhattacharya met senior Congress leaders in Delhi. Meanwhile dissenting voices against the Left-Congress alliance emerged in the Pradesh Congress as two party leaders were expelled from the party as anti-alliance posters appeared in their name.
title: TMC not ‘bothered’ about Left-Cong. ties
